problem_text:
Can a non-abelian one-relator group be the group of all automorphisms of some group?
M. V. Neshchadim
answer: Yes, it can: in (D. J. Collins, Proc. London Math. Soc. (3), 36 (1978), no. 3, 480–493) it was proved that for integers r, s such that (r, s) = 1, |r| ̸= |s|, and r − s is even, the group G = ⟨a, b | a−1bra = bs⟩ is isomorphic to Aut(Aut(G)) (V. A. Churkin, Letter of 5 April 2006).
